patient_information: Age: 22 years Sex: female Location: Ashulia near Dhaka, Bangladesh Travel history: recently attended a religious festival where water was supplied in large metal containers
chief_complaint: profuse watery diarrhea for several days
history_of_present_illness: Onset of symptoms shortly after attending the religious festival, with severe dehydration and electrolyte derangement
exposure_and_epidemiology: Travel history: recently attended a religious festival in Bangladesh where water was supplied in large metal containers Symptoms onset: shortly after returning from the festival
vitals: Temperature: normal Heart rate: 110 bpm Respiratory rate: low volume Blood pressure: 90/50 mmHg Oxygen saturation: normal
physical_exam: General appearance: stuporous and minimally responsive to painful stimuli (GCS 9/15) Skin: sunken eyes, dry mouth, scaphoid abdomen Respiratory system: no abnormal findings Cardiovascular system: low volume circulation Abdomen: scaphoid
labs_and_diagnostics: Laboratory results: [{"parameter": "sodium", "value": "143.8 mmol/L"}, {"parameter": "potassium", "value": "3.0 mmol/L"}, {"parameter": "chloride", "value": "103.8 mmol/L"}, {"parameter": "bicarbonate", "value": "11.4 mmol/L"}, {"parameter": "lactic acid (venous)", "value": "4.1 mmol/L"}, {"parameter": "creatinine", "value": "203 Î¼mol/L"}, {"parameter": "blood urea nitrogen", "value": "8.6 mmol/L"}] Stool examination: {"macroscopic": "liquid stool, rice-water appearance with no faeces matter", "microscopic": "small slender curved bacilli with darting motility"} Stool culture: {"organism": "Vibrio cholerae (Ogawa serotype, El Tor biotype)"}
management_and_clinical_course: {'treatment': [{'procedure': "intravenous rehydration with Ringer's lactate solution"}, {'monitoring': 'observing for signs of dehydration and electrolyte imbalance'}], 'clinical_progress': {'improvement': 'pulmonary rate and blood pressure improved', 'outcome': 'recovered within 3 hours'}}
final_diagnosis: Diagnosis: cholera due to Vibrio cholerae (Ogawa serotype, El Tor biotype) Confirmation method: positive stool culture for V. cholerae Evidence: clinical presentation with severe dehydration and electrolyte derangement
